para.text: Track and monitor the preparedness of:
The early childhood population of children 3 and 4 years of age to determine the children’s readiness for entry and achievement in DCPS; and
Children in kindergarten through 3rd grade in DCPS to determine their readiness for entry and achievement in the 4th grade;
The early childhood population of children 3 and 4 years of age who are not ready for entry and achievement in DCPS; and
Children in kindergarten through 3rd grade in DCPS who are not ready for entry and achievement in the 4th grade;
Conduct readiness evaluations annually to ascertain whether:
Children 3 and 4 years of age are prepared for kindergarten; and
Children in the 3rd grade are prepared to be promoted to the 4th grade; and
Submit to the Council and the Mayor, by October 1 of each year:
The results of the readiness evaluations required by paragraph (3) of this section; and
A DCPS annual report for the preceding academic year delineating the progress and readiness of all students.
